channel.title: New to modelling
channel.description:
Im jsut going to give you guys a little tip, don't think that you will get amazing at modeling in a week! If you want to be a pro at the one tool, it can take up to 10k hours!
yes a little random, but should hopefully put less strain on you guys ^^

item.title: New to modelling
item.dc:creator: @archerer98 Archer
item.description:
@archerer98 wrote:

[quote=“Assassins Creed Fan, post:6, topic:301561”][quote author=johno2 link=topic=397846.msg2953078#msg2953078 date=1252661750]
If you want to be a pro at the one tool, it can take up to 10k hours!
[/quote]Beg your pardon, 10,000 hours?
That’s a little too much don’tcha think?
I mean one year only has 8760 hours.
And it won’t take over a year to get Pro at modelling,
well maybe it can get up to a year but it’s just how much time you spend to
it and how fast you advance in modelling experience.

Just if you want to be an experienced modeler you don’t have to be Pro at all.
There are enough of amateur modelers who can show you some awesome skills.

To get advanced in modeling takes time indeed,
but it doesn’t take over a year if you practice in a regular base.[/quote]

It can take up to ten years to be a pro modeler. By Pro, I don’t mean you can make one model look good, you can make anything you want without any problems and everything about what you make will be perfect. But you can get really good in the course of a year of practice no doubt.

Read full topic

item.title: New to modelling
item.dc:creator: @Assassins_Creed_Fan Assassins Creed Fan
item.description:
@Assassins_Creed_Fan wrote:

[quote=“johno2, post:1, topic:301561”]If you want to be a pro at the one tool, it can take up to 10k hours![/quote]Beg your pardon, 10,000 hours?
That’s a little too much don’tcha think?
I mean one year only has 8760 hours.
And it won’t take over a year to get Pro at modelling,
well maybe it can get up to a year but it’s just how much time you spend to
it and how fast you advance in modelling experience.

Just if you want to be an experienced modeler you don’t have to be Pro at all.
There are enough of amateur modelers who can show you some awesome skills.

To get advanced in modeling takes time indeed,
but it doesn’t take over a year if you practice in a regular base.

Read full topic

item.title: New to modelling
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

davidi2:

Actually its not random. Its spam. Trying to get your post count up.

Are you kidding me? Im just trying to help, get a lot of presure of the new modelers, but if you really want it that way i guess i could

+1…

Seriously dude, i don’t even need to get my post count up… Over 1k posts made that clear enough…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 11, 2009, 07:59:00 am[/size][hr][quote=“jjones10, post:4, topic:301561”]10k hours? eh… i think just moddeling randomly, getting used to tools, stuff like that for maybe an hour a day, you can be “pro” in almost no-time[/quote]

Trust me, pro at a tool means something like… Oblivion style, or fallout 3 style, i came across this fact because one of my teachers at college has worked in the game industry for over 15 years.

Read full topic

item.title: New to modelling
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

There are only a couple of pro modelers on these forums and a couple is all we need, everyone else encys them and respect them. We can learn by ourselves
